title: How to Clean a MacBook Air Screen

steps.title: Shut off and unplug your laptop before cleaning it.
steps.content: Shut off and unplug your laptop before cleaning it. Press the power button on the keyboard to turn off your MacBook Air completely. Then, pull out the power adapter cable and any other accessories plugged into your laptop. [1] X Expert Source Jon Gholian Cleaning Specialist Expert Interview. 15 December 2020. Make sure your MacBook isn’t connected to any electrical sources. Test your laptop first. If you shut it down, the screen won’t light up when you press a button. Since you’re applying water to an electronic device, any electrical current present may mean a shock or damage to your MacBook. Always unplug any electronics before you clean them. [2] X Expert Source Jon Gholian Cleaning Specialist Expert Interview. 15 December 2020.

steps.title: Dampen a lint-free cloth with water.
steps.content: Dampen a lint-free cloth with water. Use only soft or microfiber cloths, since rougher fabrics may leave some unpleasant scratches on your MacBook’s screen. Make sure the cloth isn’t dripping water before you use it. Squeeze it to wring out excess moisture. [3] X Research source Always apply the water to the towel. Avoid putting it on your MacBook. The moisture can leak in and cause damage. [4] X Expert Source Matt Ham Computer Repair Specialist Expert Interview. 14 May 2021. Never use a paper towel or rag, as these can leave scratches on your screen. [5] X Expert Source Jon Gholian Cleaning Specialist Expert Interview. 15 December 2020.

steps.title: Wipe the screen off from top to bottom.
steps.content: Wipe the screen off from top to bottom. Starting at the top ensures that you are able to see any water droplets before they are able to get inside your MacBook. Work from corner to corner, wiping across the screen. Go back and forth a few times to eliminate any smudges or debris. Gradually work your way to the bottom. [6] X Research source An easy way to do this is to lay your MacBook flat, resting the screen end on a table. This will prevent the hinge from moving as you wipe the screen. If you see water dripping down the screen, dry it off right away.

steps.title: Use a cloth with soap and water for stubborn stains.
steps.content: Use a cloth with soap and water for stubborn stains. Get a clean microfiber cloth and dampen it with water. Squeeze it out to drain excess moisture. Then, put a tiny amount of dish soap on the cloth, about 1 teaspoon (4.9 mL) or less. Rinse the screen off with a damp cloth when you're finished scrubbing it. [7] X Research source Choose a regular liquid dish detergent. Try to avoid harsh cleaners, like those designed to cut grease and tough stains. Harsh cleaners may end up damaging your MacBook’s screen.

steps.title: Dry the screen off with a microfiber cloth.
steps.content: Dry the screen off with a microfiber cloth. Choose a clean, unused cloth and wipe down the entire screen once again. [8] X Expert Source Jon Gholian Cleaning Specialist Expert Interview. 15 December 2020. Absorb all of the moisture along the edges of the screen first to prevent them from dripping down into the heart of your MacBook. Finish up the rest of the screen and check it to see how clean it looks. [9] X Research source You may need to clean the screen more than once to make it look perfect.

steps.title: Unplug your laptop and shut it down.
steps.content: Unplug your laptop and shut it down. The isopropyl alcohol can leak into your laptop if you aren’t careful. To be safe, disconnect your MacBook’s power cord, then use the power button to turn it off. Make sure it doesn’t come back on when you touch a button.

steps.title: Dampen a microfiber cloth with isopropyl alcohol.
steps.content: Dampen a microfiber cloth with isopropyl alcohol. You don’t need a lot of the isopropyl alcohol, only about 1 teaspoon (4.9 mL) to start. Apply it to the cloth instead of the screen to avoid potential damage. [10] X Expert Source Jon Gholian Cleaning Specialist Expert Interview. 15 December 2020. Make sure the cloth isn’t dripping before you use it. If it drips, squeeze out the excess moisture. [11] X Research source Isopropyl alcohol is effective at removing fingerprints as well as marks left by the keyboard when you close your MacBook. You can get it at most general retail and drug stores. Applying the alcohol to the cloth instead of the screen helps prevent pixel damage. [12] X Expert Source Jon Gholian Cleaning Specialist Expert Interview. 15 December 2020.

steps.title: Wipe the screen with the dampened cloth.
steps.content: Wipe the screen with the dampened cloth. Move the cloth side to side over the screen. Most of the smudges will come off right away, leaving your screen clear and reflective. Pass the cloth back over the tougher areas to treat them. [13] X Research source You may need to wipe down the screen a second time with more isopropyl alcohol before your screen is completely clean.

steps.title: Rinse off the isopropyl alcohol with water.
steps.content: Rinse off the isopropyl alcohol with water. Dampen a second microfiber cloth with lukewarm water. Wring out excess moisture before using it on the screen. Then, wipe the cloth in a circular motion around the screen to finish cleaning it. [14] X Research source Dry up any water dripping down the screen as soon as you can, so it doesn’t reach the electrical components.

steps.title: Dry the screen with a clean microfiber cloth.
steps.content: Dry the screen with a clean microfiber cloth. [15] X Expert Source Jon Gholian Cleaning Specialist Expert Interview. 15 December 2020. Finish up with a third cloth. Go over the entire screen, making sure you get all of the water. Then, check your screen to see how reflective it appears. [16] X Research source

steps.title: Shut down and unplug your laptop before cleaning it.
steps.content: Shut down and unplug your laptop before cleaning it. Always turn your laptop off to avoid accidents while cleaning. It will protect your MacBook in case any liquids get inside it and end up on the electrical components. Press a button to test your MacBook. If it stays off, then you’re ready to clean it.

steps.title: Use a disinfectant wipe on the screen.
steps.content: Use a disinfectant wipe on the screen. Check the wipes before using them. Avoid any that have bleach in them, since bleach is abrasive and may damage your MacBook. Also, squeeze the wipe to make sure excess liquid isn’t going to drip into your laptop’s crevices. [17] X Research source You do not need to buy specialty wipes. Simply get a regular multipurpose pack from a general store near you. If you want wipes designed for use on MacBook’s or other electronics, you can purchase them online, but they aren’t necessary. Another method is to mix 1 part rubbing alcohol with 1-part distilled water in a spray bottle. Dampen a microfiber cloth with the solution.

steps.title: Wash off your laptop with a microfiber cloth dampened in water.
steps.content: Wash off your laptop with a microfiber cloth dampened in water. Use only a soft cloth, not a paper towel or anything else that may cause damage to your MacBook. Lightly moisten it so it isn’t dripping. If you see it dripping, wring it out to remove the excess moisture. [18] X Research source Make sure you use the cloth to clean off all of the disinfectant.

steps.title: Dry your laptop off with a clean microfiber cloth.
steps.content: Dry your laptop off with a clean microfiber cloth. Remove any remaining moisture. Your MacBook will be clean and sterile. Next time anyone touches it with grimy hands, you can give it a quick wash to keep it in working order. [19] X Research source
